fields.value: ABC News Reagan Press Conference Poll, January 1986

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Following President Reagan's press conference regarding     Libya and the December 27, 1985 terrorist attacks at the Rome and     Vienna airports, respondents were asked if they had seen the press     conference and if they felt Reagan's response to the terrorist     attacks had been too tough, not tough enough, or just about right.     Respondents' opinions were also sought on Libyan leader Colonel     Khaddafi's role in the attacks, whether the United States should take     military action even if it means risking a larger war, and the     likelihood of a major t
errorist attack against the United States     occurring in 1986. Demographic characteristics of respondents also    are included.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States
